javatools2.database
Class Database

java.lang.Object
  javatools.database.Database
      javatools2.database.Database
Direct Known Subclasses:
MySQLDatabase, OracleDatabase, PostgresDatabase
public class Database
extends javatools.database.Database

This class extends Fabian's wrapping methods with the following new features / contributions:

  • Primitive direct wrapping without incurring from boxing/unboxing overhead
  • Query with parameters

Author:
tuan

queryIntValue

public int queryIntValue(CharSequence sql)
                  throws SQLException
This is an int-primitive version of queryValue without parameter. It returns the value of a resultset if it has data, Integer.MAX_VALUE if the result set doesn't have data

query

public ResultSet query(CharSequence sql,
                       String... param)
                throws SQLException
Returns the results for a query as a ResultSet with default type and concurrency (read comments!). The preferred way to execute a query is by the query(String, ResultWrapper) method, because it ensures that the statement is closed afterwards. If you use the query(String) method instead, be sure to call Database.close(ResultSet) on the result set, because this ensures that the underlying statement is closed. The preferred way to execute an update query (i.e. INSERT/DELETE/UPDATE) is via the executeUpdate method, because it does not create an open statement. If query(String) is called with an update query, this method calls executeUpdate automatically and returns null. This is an extension of corresponding query method in Fabian's Database class with a number of string parameters.

Throws:
SQLException

query

public ResultSet query(CharSequence sql,
                       byte[] param)
                throws SQLException
Returns the results for a query as a ResultSet with default type and concurrency (read comments!). The preferred way to execute a query is by the query(String, ResultWrapper) method, because it ensures that the statement is closed afterwards. If you use the query(String) method instead, be sure to call Database.close(ResultSet) on the result set, because this ensures that the underlying statement is closed. The preferred way to execute an update query (i.e. INSERT/DELETE/UPDATE) is via the executeUpdate method, because it does not create an open statement. If query(String) is called with an update query, this method calls executeUpdate automatically and returns null. This is an extension of corresponding query method in Fabian's Database class with a varbinary parameter

Throws:
SQLException

query

public ResultSet query(CharSequence sql,
                       int... param)
                throws SQLException
Returns the results for a query as a ResultSet with default type and concurrency (read comments!). The preferred way to execute a query is by the query(String, ResultWrapper) method, because it ensures that the statement is closed afterwards. If you use the query(String) method instead, be sure to call Database.close(ResultSet) on the result set, because this ensures that the underlying statement is closed. The preferred way to execute an update query (i.e. INSERT/DELETE/UPDATE) is via the executeUpdate method, because it does not create an open statement. If query(String) is called with an update query, this method calls executeUpdate automatically and returns null. This is an extension of corresponding query method in Fabian's Database class with a number of integer parameters.

returnedExecute

public int returnedExecute(CharSequence sqlcs,
                           String returnParameter,
                           int type)
                    throws SQLException
Execute a generic query with return parameters (default type is Integer). This method gets around known bugs in Oracle's DML statements handling (http://forums.oracle.com/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=943680)

Throws:
SQLException

                    throws SQLException
